workflow.name: Create AI-generated books with GPT-4.1-mini, DALL-E, Google Drive and AWS S3
workflow.description:
# Multi-Agent Book Creation Workflow with AI Tool Node and GPT-4, DALL-E
[![Watch the video](https://wisestackai.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/multi-agent-book-creation-workflow-with-ai-tool-node-and-gpt-4-dall-e.jpg)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o1x8Tw_7FwQ)

## **Who‚Äôs it for**
This workflow is designed for:
- **Content creators** who want to generate books or structured documents automatically.  
- **Educators and trainers** who need quick course materials, eBooks, or study guides.  
- **Automation enthusiasts** exploring **multi-agent systems** using the newly released **AI Tool Node** in n8n.  
- **Developers** looking for a reference template to understand **orchestration of multiple AI agents** with structured output.  

## **How it works / What it does**
This template demonstrates a **multi-agent orchestration system** powered by AI Tool Nodes:  
1. **Trigger**: Workflow starts when a chat message is received.  
2. **Book Brief Agent**: Generates the initial book concept (title, subtitle, and outline).  
3. **Book Writer Agent**: Expands the outline into full content by collaborating with two sub-agents:  
   - **Designer Agent** ‚Üí Provides layout/design suggestions.  
   - **Content Writer Agent** ‚Üí Drafts and refines chapters.  
4. **Generate Cover Image**: AI generates a custom book cover image.  
5. **Upload to AWS S3**: Stores the cover image securely.  
6. **Configure Metadata**: Adds metadata for title, author, and description.  
7. **Build Book HTML**: Converts markdown-based content into HTML format.  
8. **Upload to Google Drive**: Saves the HTML content for processing.  
9. **Convert to PDF**: Transforms the book into a professional PDF.  
10. **Archive to Google Drive**: Final version is archived for safe storage.  

This workflow showcases **multi-agent coordination, structured parsing, and seamless integration** with cloud storage services.  

## **How to set up**
1. **Import the workflow** into n8n.  
2. Configure the following connections:  
   - **OpenAI** (for Book Brief, Book Writer, Designer, and Content Writer Agents).  
   - **AWS S3** (for image storage).  
   - **Google Drive** (for document storage & archiving).  
3. Add your API keys and credentials in **n8n credentials manager**.  
4. Test the workflow by sending a sample chat message (e.g., *‚ÄúWrite a book about AI in education‚Äù*).  
5. Verify outputs in Google Drive (HTML + PDF) and AWS S3 (cover image).  

## **Requirements**
- **n8n** (latest version with **AI Tool Node** support).  
- **OpenAI API key** (to power multi-agent models).  
- **AWS account** (with S3 bucket for storing images).  
- **Google Drive integration** (for document storage and archiving).  
- Basic familiarity with **workflow setup in n8n**.  

## **How to customize the workflow**
- **Switch Models**: Replace `gpt-4.1-mini` with other models (faster, cheaper, or more powerful).  
- **Add More Agents**: Introduce agents for **editing, fact-checking, or translation**.  
- **Change Output Format**: Export to **EPUB, DOCX, or Markdown** instead of PDF.  
- **Branding Options**: Modify the **cover generation prompt** to include company logos or specific style.  
- **Extend Storage**: Add **Dropbox, OneDrive, or Notion** integration for additional archiving.  
- **Trigger Alternatives**: Replace chat trigger with **form submission, webhook, or schedule-based runs**.  

‚úÖ This workflow acts as a **free, plug-and-play template** to showcase how **multi-agents + AI Tool Node** can work together to automate complex content creation pipelines.

workflow.name: Multi-Agent Book Creation Workflow with AI Tool Node and GPT-4, DALL-E

parameters.toolDescription:
You are Designer Agent, your job is to generate the prompt to create the book cover

The prompt must be ready for DALL¬∑E 2 and include:
- focal motif(s) matching brief.visual_motifs (1‚Äì3)
- composition with clean top third for title; safe margins
- style/medium; lighting; background texture/gradient
- color direction (brief.color_palette)
- typography guidance: ‚Äúbold sans-serif title, high contrast‚Äù
- aspect ratio mention: ‚Äúaspect ratio 1:1.6‚Äù

Do NOT generate images, return the prompt only, nothing else Do NOT return anything else.

You are a Book Writer Agent
Your task is to write the entire book in Markdown format following the provided writing_brief.

Output Rules
	‚Ä¢	Format strictly in Markdown
	‚Ä¢	No extra text, no explanations, no keys, no JSON
	‚Ä¢	No fabricated citations

Structure
	‚Ä¢	# Title page with title, subtitle, author
	‚Ä¢	## Table of Contents listing all chapters
	‚Ä¢	## Chapters (match chapter_count), use ## for chapter titles and ### for sections
	‚Ä¢	Include practical sections, examples, and brief checklists where relevant
	‚Ä¢	End with:
	‚Ä¢	## Conclusion / Key Takeaways
	‚Ä¢	## Next Steps / Further Reading (if applicable)

Constraints
	‚Ä¢	Respect language, tone, target_word_count (¬±15%), and chapter_count.
Do not add break line between chapter, each chapter should be long and informative.
Return in markdown only, nothing else.

parameters.jsonSchemaExample:
{
  "book_brief": {
    "working_title": "Navigating AI Automation",
    "subtitle": "A Practical Guide for Busy Teams",
    "topic": "AI automation for SMEs",
    "audience": "General readers with interest in the topic.",
    "goals": "Teach a simple, repeatable automation playbook.",
    "tone": "Clear, practical, friendly",
    "language": "English",
    "keywords": ["automation","AI","workflows","n8n"],
    "target_word_count": 4000,
    "chapter_count": 6
  },
  "cover_design_brief": {
    "title": "Navigating AI Automation",
    "subtitle": "A Practical Guide for Busy Teams",
    "author": "Anonymous",
    "language": "English",
    "style_descriptors": ["minimalist","bold typography","clean vector","subtle texture"],
    "visual_motifs": ["compass","grid","workflow nodes"],
    "avoid": ["logos","trademarked characters","NSFW"],
    "color_palette": "High-contrast, modern",
    "composition_notes": "Leave top third clean for bold title",
    "aspect_ratio": "1:1.6"
  },
  "writing_brief": {
    "title": "Navigating AI Automation",
    "subtitle": "A Practical Guide for Busy Teams",
    "author": "Anonymous",
    "language": "English",
    "tone": "Clear, practical, friendly",
    "target_word_count": 4000,
    "chapter_count": 6,
    "outline": ["Intro","Foundations","Core Concepts","Workflow","Case Study","Pitfalls & Next Steps"],
    "include_front_matter": true,
    "include_back_matter": true,
    "image_placeholders": true,
    "citations_policy": "none unless sources provided"
  }
}

parameters.text:
=Create a short book brief from this request:
- Topic: {{ $json.chatInput }}
- Audience (optional): Kid
- Language (optional): English
- Target word count (optional): 10000
- Chapter count (optional): 5
- Author (optional): Trung Tran

options.systemMessage:
You are General Agent. Your ONLY job in this call: return a single planning JSON object with keys
{ book_brief, cover_design_brief, writing_brief }.

Hard rules:
- Return EXACTLY one JSON object. No arrays, no markdown, no prose, no notes, no explanations.
- If a field is missing, FILL a sensible default. Do NOT ask follow-ups or add ‚Äúplease provide‚Äù.
- Top-level keys MUST be exactly: book_brief, cover_design_brief, writing_brief.
- All arrays MUST be arrays of strings/integers as appropriate (no objects unless specified).
- Language must mirror the request or default to "English".
- Audience/tone defaults: audience="General readers with interest in the topic.", tone="Clear, practical, friendly".
- Numbers are integers (e.g., target_word_count, chapter_count).

Schema (shape, not instructions):
{
  "book_brief": {
    "working_title": "string",
    "subtitle": "string",
    "topic": "string",
    "audience": "string",
    "goals": "string",
    "tone": "string",
    "language": "string",
    "keywords": ["string"],
    "target_word_count": 4000,
    "chapter_count": 6,
    "author": "string"
  },
  "cover_design_brief": {
    "title": "string",
    "subtitle": "string",
    "author": "string",
    "language": "string",
    "style_descriptors": ["string"],
    "visual_motifs": ["string"],
    "avoid": ["string"],
    "color_palette": "string",
    "composition_notes": "string",
    "aspect_ratio": "1:1.6"
  },
  "writing_brief": {
    "title": "string",
    "subtitle": "string",
    "author": "string",
    "language": "string",
    "tone": "string",
    "target_word_count": 4000,
    "chapter_count": 6,
    "outline": ["string"],
    "include_front_matter": true,
    "include_back_matter": true,
    "image_placeholders": true,
    "citations_policy": "string"
  }
}

parameters.text:
=Given the following input:
{{ $json.output.toJsonString() }}
Use the Designer Agent and Content Writer Agent to produce the final JSON output with:
1.	cover_prompt: a DALL¬∑E input prompt generated from cover_design_brief.
2.	book_content_markdown: the full book content in markdow (must be markdown format) generated from writing_brief.

options.systemMessage:
You are the Orchestration Agent responsible for managing two specialized tool agents to create a children-friendly book project. Your job is to:
	1.	Analyze the input JSON which contains:
	‚Ä¢	book_brief: metadata about the book project
	‚Ä¢	cover_design_brief: instructions for designing the book cover
	‚Ä¢	writing_brief: instructions for writing the book content
	2.	Coordinate two tool agents:
	‚Ä¢	Designer Agent ‚Üí Generate a DALL¬∑E-compatible prompt using cover_design_brief.
	‚Ä¢	Content Writer Agent ‚Üí Generate full book content in Markdown format using writing_brief.
	3.	Final Output:
	‚Ä¢	A cover prompt (string) to be used later with DALL¬∑E for cover creation.
	‚Ä¢	The full book manuscript in Markdown format, including front matter, chapters, image placeholders, and back matter as specified.
	4.	Constraints & Style:
	‚Ä¢	The book should follow the tone, audience, and structure defined in the input.
	‚Ä¢	The Designer prompt must be visual, concise, and descriptive.
	‚Ä¢	The book content must be clear, practical, friendly, and suitable for kids.
	‚Ä¢	Return the results in JSON format with two fields:
	‚Ä¢	cover_prompt
	‚Ä¢	book_content_markdown (must be markdown format)

parameters.body:
=--foo_bar_baz
Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8

{
  "name": "{{ $('Book Brief Agent').item.json.output.book_brief.working_title }}: {{ $('Book Brief Agent').item.json.output.book_brief.subtitle }}",
  "mimeType": "application/vnd.google-apps.document",
  "parents": ["{{ $json['Drive Folder ID'] }}"]
}

--foo_bar_baz
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8

{{ $json.data }}
--foo_bar_baz--

parameters.content:
# Multi-Agent Book Creation Workflow with AI Tool Node and GPT-4, DALL-E
[![Watch the video](https://wisestackai.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/multi-agent-book-creation-workflow-with-ai-tool-node-and-gpt-4-dall-e.jpg)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o1x8Tw_7FwQ)

## **Who‚Äôs it for**
This workflow is designed for:
- **Content creators** who want to generate books or structured documents automatically.  
- **Educators and trainers** who need quick course materials, eBooks, or study guides.  
- **Automation enthusiasts** exploring **multi-agent systems** using the newly released **AI Tool Node** in n8n.  
- **Developers** looking for a reference template to understand **orchestration of multiple AI agents** with structured output.  

## **How it works / What it does**
This template demonstrates a **multi-agent orchestration system** powered by AI Tool Nodes:  
1. **Trigger**: Workflow starts when a chat message is received.  
2. **Book Brief Agent**: Generates the initial book concept (title, subtitle, and outline).  
3. **Book Writer Agent**: Expands the outline into full content by collaborating with two sub-agents:  
   - **Designer Agent** ‚Üí Provides layout/design suggestions.  
   - **Content Writer Agent** ‚Üí Drafts and refines chapters.  
4. **Generate Cover Image**: AI generates a custom book cover image.  
5. **Upload to AWS S3**: Stores the cover image securely.  
6. **Configure Metadata**: Adds metadata for title, author, and description.  
7. **Build Book HTML**: Converts markdown-based content into HTML format.  
8. **Upload to Google Drive**: Saves the HTML content for processing.  
9. **Convert to PDF**: Transforms the book into a professional PDF.  
10. **Archive to Google Drive**: Final version is archived for safe storage.  

This workflow showcases **multi-agent coordination, structured parsing, and seamless integration** with cloud storage services.  

## **How to set up**
1. **Import the workflow** into n8n.  
2. Configure the following connections:  
   - **OpenAI** (for Book Brief, Book Writer, Designer, and Content Writer Agents).  
   - **AWS S3** (for image storage).  
   - **Google Drive** (for document storage & archiving).  
3. Add your API keys and credentials in **n8n credentials manager**.  
4. Test the workflow by sending a sample chat message (e.g., *‚ÄúWrite a book about AI in education‚Äù*).  
5. Verify outputs in Google Drive (HTML + PDF) and AWS S3 (cover image).  

## **Requirements**
- **n8n** (latest version with **AI Tool Node** support).  
- **OpenAI API key** (to power multi-agent models).  
- **AWS account** (with S3 bucket for storing images).  
- **Google Drive integration** (for document storage and archiving).  
- Basic familiarity with **workflow setup in n8n**.  

## **How to customize the workflow**
- **Switch Models**: Replace `gpt-4.1-mini` with other models (faster, cheaper, or more powerful).  
- **Add More Agents**: Introduce agents for **editing, fact-checking, or translation**.  
- **Change Output Format**: Export to **EPUB, DOCX, or Markdown** instead of PDF.  
- **Branding Options**: Modify the **cover generation prompt** to include company logos or specific style.  
- **Extend Storage**: Add **Dropbox, OneDrive, or Notion** integration for additional archiving.  
- **Trigger Alternatives**: Replace chat trigger with **form submission, webhook, or schedule-based runs**.  

‚úÖ This workflow acts as a **free, plug-and-play template** to showcase how **multi-agents + AI Tool Node** can work together to automate complex content creation pipelines.

### 1. Trigger on Chat Message
The workflow begins when a chat message is received, acting as the initial input to start the automation.

### 2. Generate Book Brief
The **Book Brief Agent** creates the initial concept, including the book‚Äôs title, subtitle, and structured outline.

### 3. Expand with Book Writer Agent
The **Book Writer Agent** takes the brief and expands it into detailed content by coordinating with sub-agents:
- **Designer Agent** ‚Äì suggests layout and design elements.  
- **Content Writer Agent** ‚Äì writes and refines chapters.

### 4. Create Book Cover Image
- An AI model generates a custom book cover image to visually complement the content.
- The generated cover image is securely stored in an **AWS S3 bucket**.

### 5. Build Book in HTML
- The written content is converted from Markdown into HTML format for easier formatting and conversion.
- The HTML book file is uploaded to **Google Drive** for storage and further processing.

### 6. Convert to PDF
- The HTML content is transformed into a **professional PDF document**.
- The finished PDF is archived in a specified **Google Drive folder** for safe storage and easy access.

user.name: Trung Tran
user.bio: Empowering small and medium businesses with smart automation and practical AI, no big tech team required. Youtube channel: youtube.com/@theStackExplorer
